content.description:
Granite Sphinx of Taharqo, 680 BCE
Â© The Trustees of the British Museum
The Sphinx of Taharqo likely depicts a Nubian king of the twenty-fifth dynasty.
content.question: Which of the following best describes the historical context in which the sculpture was created?

choices.label: The Nok society had emerged along the Nile River, and it influenced the artistic styles of Egypt and Nubia for several centuries.
Nubia had conquered Egypt and established a dynasty of Black Pharaohs that ruled Egypt for approximately 100 years.
European missionaries had colonized Northeast Africa and forced Egypt, Nubia, and Aksum to convert to Christianity.
The Mali Empire had grown wealthy and developed extensive trade relations with Nubia and Egypt.

content.answer: Nubia had conquered Egypt and established a dynasty of Black Pharaohs that ruled Egypt for approximately 100 years.

skill.text: 2.B: Describe a source's perspective, purpose, context, and audience.
